hln.es_handler module¶

Elasticsearch handler

ES_Handler Class

get_doctype_count(doc_type='lead')[source]¶

Fetches ES doc_type count

Args:
doc_type (str, optional): doc_type
Returns:
dict: ES query result
get_latest_leads(search_query='', count=5, offset=0)[source]¶

Retrieves latest lead docs with reporter information

Args:
search_query (str, optional): search query text count (int, optional): number of lead docs offset (int, optional): lead docs offset
Returns:
dict: ES query result
get_leadcount(agg_type, time_interval='week', size=10)[source]¶

Fetches lead docs counts grouped by aggregation type

Args:
agg_type (string): aggregation type time_interval (str, optional): date histogram time interval size (int, optional): aggregation buckets counts
Returns:
dict: ES query result - lead count grouped by aggregation type

Retrieves latest lead docs

Args:
search_query (str, optional): search query text count (int, optional): number of lead docs offset (int, optional): lead docs offset
Returns:
dict: ES query result

hln.es_queries module¶

hln.es_queries.get_categories_filter(search_categories)[source]¶

Forms categories filter

Args:
search_categories (string): categories in search text
Returns:
dict: ES filter query
hln.es_queries.get_entities_filter(search_entities)[source]¶

Forms filter dictionary for search_entities

Args:
search_entities (string): entities in search text
Returns:
dict: ES filter query
hln.es_queries.get_leads_boost_query(args)[source]¶
Forms leads boost query on basis of entities
in search text
Args:
args (dict): contains search text, categories, entities
Returns:
dict: ES query
hln.es_queries.get_leads_query(args)[source]¶
Forms leads query on basis of filters(categories and entities),
and using relevance score boost on entities match in search text
Args:
args (dict): search query dictionary containing search text,
categories, and entities
Returns:
dict: ES query

hln.views module¶

Contains Classes for different View Routes

Attributes:
url_rules (list): contains url rule objects, for add_url_rules() function

Bases: flask.views.MethodView

Base url route Class

renders main dashboard

Returns:
None
methods = ['GET']¶
class hln.views.LeadCount[source]¶

Bases: flask.views.MethodView

LeadCount url route Class

methods = ['POST']¶
post(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
Fetches lead document count based on bucket aggregations
if agg_type is None, it fetches total documents count
Returns:
string: document counts
class hln.views.Leads[source]¶

Bases: flask.views.MethodView

Leads url route Class

methods = ['POST']¶
post(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Processes search query string using nltk, and fetches latest leads from elasticsearch handler (es_handler) module

Returns:
string: processed leads docs (relevance boosted and filtered based on query)
process_query(search_query)[source]¶

Removes stopwords, extracts categories(#tags) and entities(@mentions)

Args:
search_query (string): search query string
Returns:
dict: parsed dictionary containing tokens, categories and entities

hln.views.add_url_rules(url_rules)[source]¶

Adds Flask Url Route Rules to Flask app (flask.Flask module)

Args:
url_rules (list): list of url object. Every object must have
required keys - ‘url, class, view_name’ and can have optional key - ‘methods’ (‘GET’/’POST’)
Returns:
None
hln.views.login_required(method)[source]¶

Checks Login status of user

Annotation method to check authorise url route. Wraps a function using functools module

Args:
method (class bound method): get/post methods of different a url route class
Returns:
function: wrapper function

Module contents¶

Creates Flask app and includes view url route classes

Attributes:
app (flask.Flask object): Flask application object es (ES_Handler object): Elasticsearch Handler object
